sen.j: 上人（しょうにん）とは、仏教における高僧への敬称。
sen.e: Shonin means the respective way to call high priest in Buddhism.
"Shonin" is a term of respect for a high priest in Buddhism.

sen.j: 元は『大品般若経』において智徳を備えた人物に対して敬意を払ったものであった。
sen.e: Originally it was used for person who was knowledgeable and virtuous in "Mahaprajnaparamita-sutra" to show respect.

sen.j: 日本では、貞観_(日本)6年（864年）に僧位の一つとして置かれた法橋上人の略号であったが、後に民間においても諸国を回って民衆教化にあたった僧に対して「上人」あるいは「聖人」と呼ぶようになった。
sen.e: In Japan it was a symbol of Hokkyo -shonin (A title of honor that is given to Buddhist sculptors, painters, poets, etc) which was one of the rank for monks in 864, later on the monks who traveled around and put effort into teaching people were called Shonin(上人) or Shonin (聖人) in ordinary people.

sen.j: 室町時代以後、天皇より上人号の綸旨を受けた者を「上人」と呼ぶ慣習が生まれた。
sen.e: After Muromachi period, there was a custom started to call monk as 'Shonin', who received rinji (the Emperor's command) of Shonin title.
Subsequent to the Muromachi period, there was a custom of calling monks 'Shonin,' specifically those who had received rinji (the Emperor's command) of the Shonin title.

sen.j: なお、上人号に用いる名称が宗派によって定まっている宗派がある。
sen.e: By the way in some religious school they have a certain title to use for Shonin go.

sen.j: 浄土宗では下の字に「誉」、浄土真宗では下の字に「如」（ただし本願寺などの法主に対しては綸旨の有無に関わらず上人号が用いられていた）、時宗では下の字に「阿」、日蓮宗では上の字に「日」を用いるのがそれに該当する。
sen.e: In Jodo (Pure Land) sect the Japanese character of 誉 was used for the bottom character of the name, and in Jodo shin shu (True Pure Land Sect Buddhism) Japanese character of '如' was used for the bottom character of the name, (however Shonin title was used for the chief priest of Hongan-ji Temple, whether he received rinji or not) in Ji sect the car actor of '阿' was used for the bottom character of the name, in Nichiren sect, the character of '日' was used for the top part of the name.
